# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/idna/idnadata.py
@source-hash: 76a470cadce48c81
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:48Z

**Primary Purpose & Responsibility**
Auto-generated Unicode data tables for IDNA (Internationalized Domain Names in Applications) processing. Contains script classification, Unicode character joining types, and codepoint validation classes essential for domain name internationalization.

**Key Data Structures & Their Roles**

- **`__version__` (L3)**: Data version identifier "15.1.0"
- **`scripts` (L4-102)**: Maps script names to Unicode codepoint ranges
  - Greek (L5-42): Contains ranges for Greek script characters
  - Han (L43-66): CJK ideographic character ranges  
  - Hebrew (L67-77): Hebrew script character ranges
  - Hiragana (L78-85): Japanese hiragana script ranges
  - Katakana (L86-101): Japanese katakana script ranges
- **`joining_types` (L103-3028)**: Maps Unicode codepoints to joining behavior values
  - Value 84: Non-joining/transparent characters
  - Value 82: Right-joining characters 
  - Value 68: Dual-joining characters
  - Value 67: Join-causing characters
  - Value 76: Left-joining characters
- **`codepoint_classes` (L3029-4245)**: Maps validation class names to codepoint ranges
  - 'PVALID' (L3030-4233): Valid characters for domain names
  - 'CONTEXTJ' (L4234-4236): Context-dependent joining characters (ZWJ/ZWNJ)
  - 'CONTEXTO' (L4237-4245): Context-dependent other characters (middle dot, etc.)

**Important Dependencies & Relationships**
- Generated by tools/idna-data (L1) - not meant for manual editing
- Used by IDNA processing libraries for Unicode domain name validation
- Codepoint ranges stored as packed integers (start<<16 | end format)
- Joining types follow Unicode bidirectional algorithm requirements

**Notable Patterns & Architectural Decisions**
- Compact representation using integer ranges rather than individual codepoints
- Hierarchical organization: scripts → joining behavior → validation classes
- Values in joining_types correspond to Unicode Joining_Type property constants
- PVALID ranges represent the largest set of allowed characters
- CONTEXTJ/CONTEXTO require additional validation rules beyond simple lookup

**Critical Invariants & Constraints**
- All ranges are non-overlapping within each category
- Codepoint values must be valid Unicode scalar values
- Joining type values must match Unicode standard definitions
- Version must correspond to Unicode database version used for generation
